kaninator.graphics
Class Animation

java.lang.Object
  kaninator.graphics.Animation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Drawable
public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
implements Drawable

The class representing animations in the engine. An Animation is a series of Drawables we iterate through while drawing them. Animation also implements the Drawable interface and can consequently be drawn by a Canvas object. Animations should only be constructed via the AnimationFactory to prevent duplicates.

Author:
phedman
See Also:
AnimationFactory, Drawable, Canvas

Constructor Detail

Animation

protected Animation(java.util.ArrayList<Drawable> _frames,
                    double _speed)
Constructs an Animation from an ArrayList of drawables and sets the Animation speed. For internal use only. Use AnimationFactory to create Animations.

Parameters:
_frames - The Drawables that will make up the Animation in the end.
_speed - The speed (in frames) the animation will advance each time it's advanced.
Method Detail

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                 int x,
                 int y)
Draws the active frame of the Animation to the coordinates in the parameters.

Specified by:
draw in interface Drawable
Parameters:
g - The graphics context the Animation will be drawn to.
x - The x coordinate for the Animation.
y - The y coordinate for the Animation.

getWidth in interface Drawable
Returns:
The width of the current frame of the Animation.

advance

public void advance()
Advances the animation [speed] amount of frames. If the current frame exceeds or meets the maximum amount of frames in the animation, then the animation will reset itself or if the lock is set to true, lock itself to the last frame of the Animation.

setLock

public void setLock(boolean _lock)
Sets the Animation lock. In essence deciding if the animation will loop or just get stuck at the last frame.

Parameters:
_lock - True if the animation should be locked at the last frame, False if the Animation should loop.

setSpeed

public void setSpeed(double _speed)
Sets the Animation speed. In essence the amount of frames the animation will advance each time it is advanced.

Parameters:
_speed - The amount of frames the animation should advance each time it is advanced.

reset

public void reset()
Resets the animation to the first frame.

update

public void update()
Updates all the drawables in the Animation. Effectively reloading them into VRAM (and changing their transparency settings).

Specified by:
update in interface Drawable

clone

public Animation clone()
Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
